q: What are common flood-panel repair issues?
a: Typical repairs include gasket deterioration, bent frames from impact, and stripped clamps. Minor aluminum warps ≤2 mm can be straightened using press blocks. Heavier damage requires factory re-certification.

q: When should damaged hardware be replaced?
a: Immediately if threads are corroded or heads stripped. Always use 316 SS replacements. Mix-metal hardware voids corrosion warranty.

q: How can I test repaired panels?
a: Perform hydrostatic test to 1.5× expected flood height. Document date and results for insurance submission.
